definitions: process of replanting forests in areas where trees have been removed or destroyed
examples: The reforestation project aims to restore the damaged ecosystem
Government funding supports reforestation efforts across the country

definitions: sixteenth-century religious movement that led to the establishment of Protestant churches
process of making significant changes to improve something that exists
examples: The Reformation transformed religious practices throughout Europe permanently
Martin Luther played a crucial role in the Reformation
The prison system underwent major reformation to reduce recidivism
Educational reformation requires input from teachers and parents alike

definitions: institution for young offenders designed to reform rather than simply punish
examples: The juvenile was sent to a reformatory instead of prison
The old reformatory building has been converted into apartments

definitions: person who works to improve social, political, or religious systems through change
examples: The social reformer advocated for better working conditions in factories
Educational reformers push for innovative teaching methods in schools

definitions: belief in gradual political and social change through democratic means rather than revolution
examples: The party's reformism appealed to moderate voters seeking practical solutions
Critics argued that reformism was too slow to address urgent problems

definitions: person who supports gradual reform rather than revolutionary change in society
examples: The reformist politician proposed incremental changes to healthcare policy
Reformist movements gained momentum during the economic crisis period

definitions: change in direction of light waves when passing from one medium to another
examples: Refraction causes objects in water to appear displaced from reality
The lens uses refraction to focus light onto the sensor

definitions: material capable of withstanding very high temperatures without melting or breaking down
medical condition that does not respond to standard treatment methods
examples: The furnace is lined with refractory bricks to withstand extreme heat
Refractory materials are essential in steel production and glass manufacturing
The patient has refractory epilepsy that resists conventional medication therapy
Refractory depression may require alternative treatment approaches for management

definitions: recurring section of music or poetry that repeats at regular intervals
examples: The catchy refrain made the song easy to remember instantly
Everyone joined in singing the refrain at the concert

definitions: course or training session designed to update or review previously learned skills
examples: The nurse attended a refresher course on emergency procedures annually
The company offers refresher training for all safety protocols regularly

definitions: light food and drinks served at social gatherings or during breaks
examples: Refreshments will be served during the conference's afternoon break session
The host prepared various refreshments for the evening reception guests

definitions: substance used in refrigeration systems to absorb and release heat for cooling
examples: The technician checked the refrigerant levels in the air conditioner
Modern refrigerants are designed to minimize environmental impact and damage

definitions: process of removing heat to preserve food or maintain cool temperatures
examples: Proper refrigeration prevents food spoilage and extends shelf life significantly
The vaccine requires constant refrigeration to remain effective and safe

definitions: electrical appliance that keeps food and drinks cold through mechanical cooling
examples: The refrigerator needs regular cleaning to maintain proper hygiene standards
Energy-efficient refrigerators can significantly reduce monthly electricity bills

definitions: process of adding fuel to a vehicle, aircraft, or other machinery
examples: The plane made a refueling stop before crossing the ocean
Regular refueling stations are located every fifty miles along highways

definitions: place providing safety and protection from danger, trouble, or distress
examples: The mountain hut served as refuge during the unexpected storm
Wildlife refuges protect endangered species from hunting and development

definitions: repayment of money to someone who has returned goods or cancelled services
examples: Customers can receive a full refund within thirty days of purchase
The airline issued refunds for all cancelled flights during the strike

definitions: process of cleaning, decorating, and re-equipping a building or room to improve condition
examples: The hotel closed for refurbishment to modernize all guest rooms
Office refurbishment includes new furniture and updated technology systems

definitions: act of saying no or declining to accept, give, or do something
examples: Her refusal to compromise led to the negotiation breaking down
The company's refusal to honor warranties angered many customers significantly

definitions: act of proving a statement, theory, or argument to be false or incorrect
examples: The scientist published a detailed refutation of the controversial theory
His refutation of the accusations convinced the jury of innocence

definitions: act of getting back something that was lost or taken away
examples: Regaining muscle strength after injury requires consistent physical therapy sessions
The company focused on regaining market share through innovative products

definitions: special clothing and ornaments worn or carried at formal ceremonies as symbols of office
examples: The university president wore full academic regalia at the graduation
Royal regalia includes crowns, scepters, and other ceremonial objects

definitions: organized series of boat or yacht races held as a sporting event
examples: The annual regatta attracts sailing enthusiasts from around the world
University rowing teams compete fiercely in the spring regatta competition

definitions: period when a regent governs in place of a monarch who cannot rule
examples: The regency lasted until the prince reached the age of majority
Architecture from the Regency period features distinctive elegant style characteristics

definitions: process of regrowth, renewal, or restoration of damaged tissue, communities, or systems
examples: Urban regeneration transformed the abandoned district into thriving neighborhoods
Some animals have remarkable regeneration abilities for lost body parts

definitions: person who governs a kingdom when the monarch is unable to rule
examples: The queen mother served as regent during her son's minority
The board appointed a regent to oversee university operations temporarily

definitions: style of popular music originating in Jamaica with strong rhythmic bass lines
examples: Bob Marley helped bring reggae music to international audiences worldwide
The festival features reggae bands from Jamaica and other countries

definitions: large military unit typically commanded by a colonel and divided into battalions
examples: The regiment was deployed to the conflict zone last month
His grandfather served in the same regiment during World War Two

definitions: strong loyalty to one's own region and its interests, culture, and identity
word or expression used in a particular region but not elsewhere
examples: Political regionalism sometimes conflicts with national unity and cohesion efforts
The growth of regionalism led to demands for greater local autonomy
The dictionary includes regionalisms from various parts of the country
Understanding regionalisms helps translators capture local flavor in literature

definitions: official responsible for keeping records, especially in universities, hospitals, or government
examples: The university registrar handles all student enrollment and transcript requests
Contact the registrar's office to obtain copies of birth certificates

definitions: official list or record of items, people, or events kept for reference
examples: The cancer registry tracks patient outcomes for medical research purposes
Couples create gift registries to help wedding guests choose presents

definitions: return to an earlier or less developed state or condition
statistical method for determining relationships between variables in data analysis
examples: The patient showed regression in speech abilities after the stroke
Economic regression followed years of steady growth and prosperity
Linear regression helps predict future sales based on historical data
The study used regression analysis to identify significant risk factors

definitions: quality of being regular, uniform, or occurring at fixed intervals
examples: The regularity of her morning routine helped maintain work-life balance
Scientists noted the regularity of the comet's orbital pattern precisely

definitions: process of making something regular, legal, or conforming to established rules or standards
examples: The regularization of immigrant workers' status took several years to complete
Data regularization prevents overfitting in machine learning models and algorithms

definitions: act of controlling or maintaining something within prescribed limits or standards
examples: Regulating body temperature is essential for human survival and health
The agency is responsible for regulating pharmaceutical industry safety standards

definitions: device that controls the rate, pressure, or amount of something
person or organization that supervises a particular industry or activity
examples: The pressure regulator prevents damage to the plumbing system components
Install a voltage regulator to protect sensitive electronic equipment
The financial regulator imposed new rules on banking practices nationwide
Industry regulators ensure companies comply with safety and environmental standards

definitions: bringing swallowed food back up to the mouth or backward flow of fluids
examples: Acid regurgitation causes heartburn and discomfort after eating certain foods
Some birds feed their young through regurgitation of partially digested food

definitions: process of helping someone return to health or normal life through training and therapy
examples: Physical rehabilitation after surgery can take several months to complete
The prison offers rehabilitation programs to reduce repeat offense rates

definitions: new hearing of a legal case by the same or higher court
examples: The appeals court granted a rehearing based on new evidence discovered
Requests for rehearing must be filed within thirty days of judgment

definitions: practice session in preparation for a public performance or presentation
examples: The final dress rehearsal is scheduled for tomorrow evening at seven
Wedding rehearsals help ensure the ceremony runs smoothly on the day

definitions: period during which a monarch rules over a country or territory
examples: Queen Elizabeth's reign lasted over seventy years until her death
The peaceful reign brought prosperity and cultural advancement to the kingdom

definitions: repayment of money spent or lost, especially for business or medical expenses
examples: Submit receipts for travel reimbursement within two weeks of returning
Insurance reimbursement covered most of the medical procedure costs completely

definitions: long strap attached to a horse's bit used for controlling and directing
examples: The rider pulled gently on the reins to slow the horse
Keep a firm grip on the reins when riding on trails

definitions: religious or philosophical belief that the soul is reborn in a new body after death
examples: Many Eastern religions include reincarnation as a core spiritual belief
The concept of reincarnation offers comfort to those grieving loss

definitions: large deer found in Arctic regions, domesticated in some areas for transport
examples: Wild reindeer migrate hundreds of miles across the Arctic tundra annually
Santa's sleigh is traditionally pulled by eight flying reindeer

definitions: act of strengthening or supporting something with additional material or force
consequence that increases the likelihood of a behavior being repeated
examples: Steel reinforcement makes concrete structures much stronger and more durable
The army sent reinforcements to support troops in the conflict zone
Positive reinforcement encourages children to repeat good behavior patterns consistently
The teacher uses verbal reinforcement to motivate students during lessons

definitions: act of restoring someone or something to a former position or condition
examples: The court ordered immediate reinstatement of the wrongfully terminated employee
Reinstatement of the cancelled program pleased students and parents alike
